column5: Everyone up here is now known as Dude!
The younger generation uses hey DUDE ! In my day it was hey MAN !

I'm concerned about the border crossing wait when returning to the states. I cross 6 or 8 times a year. A couple 3 times of long waits while they cross examine folks returning, would certainly make me reconsider the travel.

THAT is also my biggest concern I wonder how the US side will handle/address this??If they don't hire more agents - I can see this as being a MAJOR impact on the lines coming back across the border...................Anybody have any insight on what the US is thinking/doing about this??????Here's one "view":https://www.420magazine.com/420-news...-legalization/This one is a little "scary":https://www.clickondetroit.com/news/...uana-in-canada
Perhaps a whole new meaning in 2019 when the term "Weed Walleye" is used. https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/marij...know-1.4862207
I think you're going to see a lot more American's stopping on the Canadian side of the border for longer than the norm, hitting up some of the local shops. If you know what I'm saying...
Wonder if Columbian will be a new choice at the Beer Store?
No I think Columbian was replaced with Train Wreck !!!
Hey Gord. I'm guessing next season you'll have a bunch of late sleepers. Stock up on twinkies too.
Going to check how much my fishing partners care about me when I ask them to rub weed oil on my old sore feet, and sore arms from catching all the walleyes:
Throws a whole different light on the term 'happy camper'.......
Going to put a dent in the Cuban Cigar business!!
Getting blitzed may take on a whole new meaning.
